1.Text: The story so far...

One summer day, Beta hands Cid a private beach
invitation from Mitsugoshi.

When he arrives, Beta and Epsilon are waiting for him.
The other members of the Seven Shadows are away
on missions.

Instead of the three spending a peaceful vacation
together, Beta and Epsilon compete as usual to show
Cid the best time.

However, as a result, Cid is satisfied with the two
taking his Shadow Wisdom seriously in their play.
Despite a few mishaps, the three have a great time.

In the end, all the members of the Seven Shadows join
in, and they enjoy making summer memories together.

Meanwhile, a young girl visits Cid's empty room while
he is away on vacation.
Cid?
Cid? Are you in there?
I'm coming in.
There is no sign of Cid in the room.

Seriously... Did he forget the recent plans we made
to go out together? He even said, "Sure, yeah," and
everything...
Could he be...intentionally avoiding me?

No, of course not. My sweet little bro wouldn't do
that to me.

You can't hide from me, you know? Your big sis sees
through everything!

With that, Claire starts searching every crack and
crevice of Cid's room.
Maybe he's in the closet! ...Nope.

Or, under the guise of being in his room, he's
actually out on the balcony... Not there either.

Maybe he's stuck to the ceiling! No, that's
probably too extreme.

*sigh* Fine! I'll search every nook and cranny then!
Don't blame me if I find anything I shouldn't under
your bed!

Claire begins to turn her brother's small room
upside-down.

Meanwhile, another young girl visits Cid's empty
room.
Hm-hmmm... Hm-hmmm…
I'm almost at Pooch's dorm.

Knowing Pooch, I'm sure he's just lazing around in his
room during summer vacation. That's why I've gone
out of my way to come here and invite him out. What
a lucky guy.

I secretly looked up the location of his dorm using
my royal privileges... Well, it's not like I'm using
my powers for something bad, so it's fine!
Now then, his dorm should be somewhere around here—
Where are you?! Seriously!

Huh? What's up with all the commotion? It's coming
from...Pooch's dorm...
Cid? I won't get mad, so come out already! Hehehe.

Alexia witnesses a bizarre scene. Claire wears an
eerie smile while calling out Cid's name as she
meticulously searches the drawers and under the
carpet in his room.
Oh...

Hm? Did I just hear a voice coming from the entrance?
So that's where you're hiding, Cid—
Wait, huh?
The two lock eyes and pause for a moment.
T-Top of the morning to you...
Princess Alexia...? What're you doing here?

N-No reason in particular. A-Actually, I heard a loud
noise nearby, so I just came to check.

I see... Well, now that you've checked, there isn't
any other reason for you to be here, is there?
Go on. Shoo.

H-Hold on. I came here because I have something to
discuss with Pooch...I mean, Cid Kagenou.

Oh...? The fact you know where Cid's room is located
means you two must be pretty close.

W-Well, you know...due to various circumstances...
But this is my first time visiting his dorm.

*sigh* Look, whatever. So, what are you plotting this
time?

I-I'm not here with some sort of ulterior motive.
I just wanted to invite Cid to hang out. I'm pretty
sure that's a normal thing for classmates to do.
...What? You came here to ask Cid on a date?!
A-A date?! I never said that!

That so? Seems pretty suspicious for you to come all
this way to his dorm. Still gonna pretend you're not
interested in Cid?

I-It's not like that... It's pretty hard finding Cid
Kagenou's location sometimes, so what else am
I supposed to do?!
Oh? Is my baby brother avoiding you? How tragic.
W-Well, Claire, you seem to be in the same boat.
Ulp...

W-We're just playing hide-and-seek right now!
He's not avoiding me at all!

In that case, he's not avoiding me either!
We're playing tag!
The two continue arguing for some time.

*pant, pant* ...Anyway, it looks like Cid Kagenou
isn't here.

That kid always ends up wandering off somewhere...
Fine, I'll search every location he could be and make
him keep his promises no matter what!
That sounds super ineffecient...
I'll go search on my own. Well, if you'll excuse me.
...Huh? There's a piece of paper behind the door—
Show it to me!
H-Hey!

I-It's...an invitation to a private beach from
Mitsugoshi to Cid! D-Did he win something?!

That brat! Going off to a resort alone and leaving
his big sis behind!

Unforgivable! I'll chase him to the ends of the
earth! Wait until I get my hands on you, Cid!
Oh, h-hold on! I-I'm coming too!
The two leave Cid's room in a mess and rush out.

2.Text:
Claire and Alexia arrive at Mitsugoshi's private
beach specified in the invitation.

Wow! What a lovely place! Mitsugoshi really is
incredible!

It truly is a beautiful place! I would love to visit
with my sister next time!
...Who gave you permission to follow me here?

It just so happens we're here for the same reason.
Besides, I was the one who found the letter first.
That's irrelevant.

Anyway, it's silly for one person to search such a
large place alone. Let's work together.

It's no big deal, but fine. I'll let you help me
search.

But you have to hand him over to me once we find him,
understood?

Fine, fine, got it. You're just as self-centered as
he is...
...Did you say something?
No, nothing.

By the way, thanks for helping me out with the
swimsuit. It would've been a bummer if we couldn't
swim in the sea after finding Cid.

I brought several swimsuits just in case something
like this happened. I've only worn some of them
once, so if you like any, I can give them to you.

You'd discard such an adorable swimsuit after only
wearing it once?! That's such an aristocratic way to
splurge money...

If you don't want it, you can always hand it back to
me, you know?

Um! W-Well, it is a cute swimsuit and probably
expensive... I might as well accept it...

You're surprisingly straightforward. You really are
just like him in some ways...
Huh, just like Cid?

Yes, in terms of being self-centered and susceptible
to money.
True! Cid is just like me, isn't he? Hehehe...
You know, you're not so bad sometimes.
I-I wasn't trying to compliment you...

Come on, let's find Cid together. He's probably just
inspecting the place before inviting me!
I doubt that...
So, how do you plan on finding him?
Well...let's split up.
Huh?
Is there a problem?

Knowing you, I thought you'd want to keep a watchful
eye on me...I mean, keep me nearby.

Right now, I want to find Cid as quickly as possible.
We don't even know if he's here.

Of course, you must bring him to me as soon as you
find him. That was our agreement. A princess wouldn't
break her promise...would she?
U-Understood...

And so, the two decide to split up and search for
Cid. Claire searches the beach while Alexia searches
inside the hotel.

Meanwhile, Cid remains oblivious to the unfolding
situation...
Ah! That was another amazing day!

The food is fresh and tasty, and I can train on the
beach as much as I want. I'm grateful to Gamma and
the others for allowing me to stay here for so long.

(Anyway, Beta and Epsilon have really improved at
Beach Flags.)

(After that, they played against the others, and they
even beat Delta with her incredible speed and power.
It was great to see them dominating through their
efforts!)

(But Alpha and Zeta quickly got the hang of it and
effortlessly caught up with their skills... Hmm...
Talent is a cruel mistress.)

(Beta and Epsilon looked understandably frustrated.
Maybe I should teach those geniuses to read the
room...)

(Alpha and the others were busy and took off again,
but they said I could stay here as long as I wanted.
I might lose track of when to leave.)
Well, I guess I can enjoy myself a little more first—
Eeek!
Oh! S-Sorry about that. Are you okay—
No, it's my fault for not paying atten—
Oh...
Oh...

In front of him stands a princess who he has seen
somewhere before.
You don't seem hurt. Welp, I'll be going now...
Hey! Don't pretend you don't know me!
Y-You're mistaking me for someone else!
Cid flees with blinding speed.
...Whoa, he's fast!
Wait! Get back here!

What is Alexia doing here?! This is supposed to be
Mitsugoshi's private beach!

Could there be other invitees besides me? But they
told me this was all just for me, so maybe some kind
of trouble is afoot...

Anyway, it looks like the carefree vacation I had
until yesterday is over. What should I do now?
Cid decides to hide and consider his next actions.

3.Text:
Meanwhile, Alexia finds herself left behind at the
hotel...
*pant, pant* Where did he go? He's one fast runner!

If he's hiding in a room, I'll never be able to find
him. What should I do?

Just then, the door to a nearby room opens, and
Alexia hears a familiar voice.
Well then, guess I'll go for a swim today.
Huh...Natsume?!
...Hm? Did someone say "Natsume"—

Wh-Whoa! It's the catty princess...I mean, Princess
Alexia! What're you doing here?!
Right back at you! Why are you here?

W-Well, I received an exclusive invitation from
Mitsugoshi. It's some kind of pre-opening, limited
to invited guests.
So...what're you doing here, Princess Alexia?

I-I'm here for the same reason. I actually also
received an invitation from Mitsugoshi.
Th-That's a lie!

It's not like you work for Mitsugoshi, so how can you
prove it?

Unless, of course, you're receiving special treatment
from Mitsugoshi, or they've been careless with
handling their customers' personal information...
Well...

Anyway, now isn't the time to be arguing about this!
I need to report to Claire immediately!
Huh?!

(Sh-She's here with Lady Claire?! Then maybe she was
actually invited?!)

(...Anyway, I wouldn't want any trouble after turning
them away. I'll need to act cautiously until I can
work out what's going on...)

...Well then, as fellow invited guests, let's just
get along, shall we? See you later!
W-Wait a minute! ...And she's gone.

At any rate, this is an emergency... I'll need to
inform Master Shadow and Epsilon!

Having run into Alexia and fled, Cid walks along the
shore.

Hmm, it'll be tough to keep running like this. Guess
I'll just have to give up and head back to my dorm...

That said...infiltrating Mitsugoshi's private beach
is just plain crazy.

Or maybe it's just a coincidence she ended up here...
Hmm, is that even possible?
Finally...found you...

Oh, true. There's always the chance she ended up
here while searching for someone...
Found...you...
Huhhh?! C-Claire?!

(D-Damn it! I should've considered someone else
might be here when I ran into Alexia!)

I finally found you! You seem to be having a lot
of fun without your big sis.
Have you forgotten...the promise you made me?

(This is bad. I really don't remember... She must
be referring to some promise I agreed to without
thinking...)

O-Of course not. Um... Was it about giving you a
present?
...I do want a present, but that's not it.

Really? I've made you so many promises that it's hard
to know which you're talking about. Oh, was it to treat
you to something yummy?

...That would be nice as well, but no! You totally
don't remember, do you?!
Wait! I'll remember it! Just give me a second!

(Ack! I'm being completely strong-armed here!
What the heck should I do?!)
(Looks like I'll have to use...my last resort!)
Today is the day I won't put up with your—
E-Enough already!
...Huh?

Cid glares at Claire with an uncharacteristically
harsh expression.
What's with the sudden attitude?

...I'm an adult now. I'm not a kid anymore who always
plays with his big sister.
Cid...?

I want to graduate from playing...with family.
Hanging out with friends or on my own is
more fun.

B-But we used to have so much fun together!
What's gotten into you all of a sudden?

I told you, I'm an adult now! Don't say anything
more...or I'll...
Hey! Stop! Don't say it!
Cid...would you really ha...hate your big sister?

(Ooh... It's working! I call this technique "Teenage
Rebellion," the side character's hidden technique!
Heh! I never thought I'd have to resort to such
measures...)
Hate me...? Oh, Cid...

Well...I'm going. D-Don't follow me! A-And knock
before coming into my room!

Taking advantage of Claire's hesitation, Cid
disappears.
He...hates me...

There you are...Claire! Did Pooch...I mean, Cid
come this way? I ran into him just now, but he
managed to get away...
...Claire?
It's fine... Forget it...
Hey, what's the matter? Claire!

Alexia becomes anxious at the complete change in
Claire and determines to find out what happened...

4.Text:
Claire feels completely dejected after taking Cid's
teenage angst tactic to heart.

Alexia manages to extract some answers from the
depressed Claire. However...

I just bought some food from over there. How about
trying a bite, Claire? It's delicious, you know?
Cid loves me... He loves me...not...

Hey, look at those beautiful shells! They're
adorable! Oh, I'm sure they'll look great on
you, Claire!
...He loves me... He loves me not... He loves me...

Wow! It feels so good dipping my feet in the ocean!
Care to join me, Claire?
...He loves me not. Waaah....

...Jeez! Get it together! Why're you using seaweed
instead of daisy petals anyway?!

Oh, come on! It's not like I want to be doing this!
But I can't calm down, so what am I supposed to do?!

This is all Cid's fault! He has no clue how much I
care about him all the time!

He never keeps a single promise! He doesn't care
about me at all!

He better not think he can come crying to me once
I'm gone!

Saying this, Claire runs towards the sea as if to
vent her feelings.

*sigh* I can't tell if she's depressed or upset...but
maybe it's a good way for her to cool her head.

But seriously, why did Pooch do something like that
to Claire? Was it teenage angst?

Well, I'm in no position to judge since I've had my
share of issues with my older sister.

Best not to leave Claire alone in her current state,
so I'll keep an eye on her for a while.
Oh, this takoyaki is really good.
A while later...
Whew... I'm beat...
Oh, you're still here?
Come on, don't be like that.
You're surprisingly nosey, aren't you?
I'd prefer you'd use the term "caring"...
As this exchange goes on, Claire sits next to Alexia.
...So, you feeling better now?
...A little, I guess.

But I still haven't genuinely come to terms with what
happened. I'm just composing myself for now.

*sigh* I wonder how I should face him the next time.
I don't know what I want or what went wrong...
I don't understand anything.
Claire...
I think I understand...how you feel.
...How?

I also once had a falling out with my older sister.
In my case, it was completely one-sided, triggered
by my inferiority complex.
I see...

It started off as a simple misunderstanding. But day
by day, my feelings grew more intense, spiraling into
something uncontrollable.

I actually only reconciled with her recently. It took
quite a bit of time.
I didn't intend for it to be that way.

That's why I don't want that to happen to you
and Pooch.

If you want to keep being friends, maybe you could
build an even stronger relationship by considering
his feelings and taking a step back.
Alexia...
...I wonder if I'm...getting in his way.
Why do you think that?

I've been feeling more distance between us—just a
little, but I thought it was just his way of hiding
his shyness.

But after being outright rejected like that, it makes
me wonder...where I went wrong.

Heheh. You haven't done anything wrong. He's just
going through his rebellious phase.
...You really think so?
Absolutely. He's as stubborn as it gets...
...I'm starting to feel silly overthinking things.
That's the spirit.
Thank you, Princess Alexia.

You're welcome...although honestly, being properly
thanked by you feels weird.
Wh-What's that supposed to mean?!
Heheh. I think that attitude suits you better.

Keep talking! Seriously... You'd better forget
everything that happened today!

If you keep pressuring me like that, I might just tell
your brother exactly how you reacted, you know?
Grr!

Thanks to Alexia, Claire manages to return to her
normal self. Meanwhile...

My teenage angst tactic...worked a little too well...
I didn't expect Claire to get so depressed. It's a
good thing Alexia was there to cheer her up.

I've been avoiding her a little too much lately, and
who knows what she might do if I keep this up.
Maybe it's time to let her blow off some steam…

Hidden behind a boulder, Cid ponders these
thoughts...

5.Text: The next morning...
Whew! The sea breeze feels good!
Sure does.
What's gotten into you?
I've been like this since we got here.
You sure? Well, never mind.
That said, I'm surprised they let us stay the night.

As a last resort, I asked the front desk, and they
gave us rooms.

I thought I heard the staff call me "Lady Claire,"
but did I ever introduce myself to them? Or
maybe I also secretly won an invitation?

It's often the case that staff will remember a
client's face and name.

Ack! Have I been shopping too much at Mitsugoshi?
I hadn't thought I'd gone that much this month...

Mitsugoshi is super generous. They really are a
wonderful company, despite the fact we're intruders.
Huh? So you grasp the fact we're intruders?
Of course I do. What're you talking about?
No, nothing...

(She's supposed to be an honor student and level-
headed in that sense... Her words and actions don't
match up at all. Maybe she loses her sense of herself
when it comes to Pooch...)
Heheh. You seem back to your usual self.

I'm not feeling down at all. Now, let's keep looking
for Cid today!
Okay, okay.

Having opened up to each other a little, the two
continue their search for Cid.
Meanwhile, returning to Beta and Epsilon...
So, what's the current situation?

Like I told you yesterday, Princess Alexia and Lady
Claire wandered onto this beach. Their purpose or
intent is unknown.

...It's a troublesome situation. It's one thing for
Princess Alexia to be here, but I can't believe
Lady Claire is here as well…

Yes, indeed... Master Shadow has been missing since
yesterday, and we don't have a proper grasp of the
situation. It's dangerous to act recklessly.
What should we do next?

First of all, we should avoid making any hasty moves.
Our top priority is to act naturally.

And let's eliminate any concerns based on this
situation. For example, the objectively bizarre fact
that only Master Shadow was invited to this beach.

I see. By making our presence known, we eliminate any
suspicion regarding who was invited.

I've already contacted the Mitsugoshi staff and
arranged to increase the number of invitees.

We'll buy some time until then. Let's present
ourselves now to display the presence of other
guests.
Alright, now that that's decided...
Let's put our plan into action.
...We can't seem to find him anywhere.

Yes, but after everything he said, I don't expect to
find him anytime soon.
You seem pretty calm about it.

Of course I'm calm. I'm thinking there's a chance
he's already back at his dorm.
Yes, we can't rule that out.

He can be surprisingly stubborn when he sets his mind
to it.

If he wants to spend time alone...he'll make sure
it happens.
You seem to understand Cid Kagenou really well.
Of course. I'm his big sister.
Anyway, I'm willing to give up...this time.
What? Are you sure?
It's my fault things turned out this way.

That said...it'll be a shame to just leave like this.
I mean, we came all the way to the beach...
True. How about we have some fun before heading back?
Good idea. Let's go for a quick swim—
Ah, Princess Alexia! There you are!
Hey, Natsume! Wait for me!
Oh, there are others?

6.Text: Hey there, Princess Alexia!
...Natsume?
So, Princess Alexia, you're here to swim as well.

...Oh, and you've brought a friend! Perhaps she's
also a member of the royal family?
Oh, no, I'm...

She's an acquaintance of mine. She wasn't officially
invited but was permitted to join me as my companion.

Alexia is slightly cautious as she maneuvers herself
as if to protect Claire.

I see! My name is Natsume, and I'm a novelist.
Pleased to make your acquaintance.

Huh, Natsu...me? H-Hello. I'm Claire Kagenou. Nice to
meet you...
Pr-Princess Alexia? Is she THAT Natsume?

Yes, she's apparently become famous recently.
You've heard of her too, Claire?
O-Of course I have! She's super famous!

Oh my, I feel out of my element! Should I even be
here?

We're all just here on holiday, so let's not think
like that, okay?
Oh! Th-Thank you.
Natsume seems like a really nice person.
...I guess this is a case of like hating like.
Hm? Did you say something?
No, nothing.
Who's that next to you?
Oh, this is my assistant!
A-Assistant?! I'm a singer called Shi—
Beta covers Epsilon's mouth with her hand.
Mmmmhh! (Why are you stopping me?!)

There's no need to give them information they don't
know already! It'll only cause trouble down the line!
Mmnn... (True...)
...Pwahh!
Y-Yes... I am Natsume's assistant...
N-Nice to meet you...
...So, what business do you have with us?

Oh, nothing so dramatic. I just thought it would be
nice to speak with the other invited guests.

By the way, I heard you two were wandering around
here yesterday. Did you come for any other reason
than swimming?

Beta casually probes what Alexia and Claire are
up to.

Oh, it's nothing. We were just looking for someone.
We'd made plans to hang out together here, but they
couldn't make it on the day...
(Plans to hang out?)

Oh my, making plans for a summer beach rendezvous...
Is this individual your lover, Princess Alexia?

Wh-What? No! It wasn't me. Claire, right here, was
the one who made the plans!

B-Besides, what Pooch and I had is already in the
past... Well, not that I mind being mistaken for a
couple...

(What? She's reacting as if they have some sort of
relationship... How annoying!)

(...Whoops, I accidentally let slip my personal
feelings. I see, so they were looking for Master
Shadow after all.)

(Seeing how Master Shadow is avoiding them, it would
be best for us to distract and stall them here...
Alright then.)

Ah, my apologies. I do hope you find this individual
soon.

But doesn't it get quite boring just strolling around
such a beautiful place?

Yes, I agree. In fact, we were just planning to put
our search on hold and enjoy the beach instead.

In that case, I know a great game! Would you like to
play with us? It's called Beach Flags...
Beach Flags?

It's like a short-distance sprint with a slight
twist! The close competition is what makes
it interesting.

Wow, I'm interested! We might as well give it a try
since we're here.
What do you think, Princess Alexia?
Y-Yes! Of course!

(I feel like we're being skillfully steered by
Natsume, but...we were bored anyway, so
why not?)
Great! We'll get it ready right away!

With that, Beta and Epsilon begin drawing lines on
the sandy beach and preparing the flags.

Well, Princess Alexia, would you like to practice
with me for starters?
Very well. I'm ready whenever you are.

(Heheh... Regardless of the circumstances, the day
has finally come when I can directly challenge this
woman!)

(What if I beat her so badly that she never wants to
play again? Maybe she'll get fed up to the point that
she cries? Ooops, I didn't mean to go that far!)
Hehe... Hehehehe!
You've got a...terrifying look on your face...
Best of luck, you two!
Alright then! Ready...
Set...
Hehe...
Go!

(Hup! Turning over from a crouching position is
harder than I expected.)

(No way! Natsume is already up and running! How is
there such a big gap from the start?!)

(Heheh. How much do you think I've practiced? There's
no way I'm losing to an amateur!)

Beta defeats Alexia effortlessly and proudly raises
the flag.
Natsume is...merciless...
*pant, pant*
Oops, sorry! Got a little carried away!
(Come on, show me your frustrated face!)
Whoa...
That was fun!
Huh...?
Let's do it again! Again!

I wonder if I can get that fast by practicing! Next!
I wanna do it too!

Oh, then let's try with the three of us. You don't
mind, do you?
N-No, it's fine.

(Come to think of it, they're both fundamentally
competitive...)

(Well, we've successfully distracted them from their
original goal...so I guess it's fine.)
How about your assistant also joins us?

Huh? Me too? I'd like to, but what about the starting
signal?

We can all just count together! Let's do teams since
we can compete two versus two.
R-Right... I guess we can take you up on that offer...

They set up the flags again, and the four girls line
up in position.

7.Text:
After that, the four play several rounds of Beach
Flags.

Either Beta or Epsilon mercilessly claims victory in
each round, while Alexia and Claire struggle to win
at least one. However...
*pant, pant* Both of you are really fast!
Tha... That's right... You're merciless...
Oh? Would you prefer if we went easy on you?

...No! Absolutely not! Just you see! I'm gonna win
one round if it's the last thing I do!

I-If you keep it up a bit more, you might eventually
be able to win!

(I feel like we're being merciless, but it's a
dilemma since they clearly dislike the idea
of us going easy on them...)

Hmm, I wonder what's wrong. We train too, and our
physiques aren't that different...

I think we should work on our starting sprints.
That's when we have them both in our line of
sight.

True! It's a short-distance race anyway, so it may
be best to go all out from the start!

Now that that's decided, we'll win the next round
for sure!
That's right!

That's the spirit, you two! I won't go easy on you,
so do your best!

(Ack... They're just making it harder for me to
lose!)

(I've been pushing my body hard multiple days
in a row, so I'm starting to feel sore in my legs...
Epsilon must be feeling it too...)

Beta makes eye contact with Epsilon, and she gets the
hint.

(Next round, we're going to completely beat them and
come up with an excuse to take a break.)

They set up the flags once again, and the four girls
line up in position.
Alright, let's start counting down! Five! Four!
Three!
Two!
One!
On cue, they all start simultaneously.

(Oh, I managed to focus and get off to a good start!
This might be the best I've done so far!)

(Alright! Great start! But I still can't catch up
with the top two! Just a bit more! Come on!)

(Not a bad start. I understand the joy of improving...
but we're directly instructed by Master Shadow. It's
unfortunate, but we're fundamentally different from
you.)
(Now all that's left is to win—)

At the halfway point to the flag, Beta feels a sharp
pain in her leg.
(Wait! M-My leg! It's cramping!)

Beta manages to avoid falling, but her staggering
body hinders Epsilon.
Whoa! Hey! Watch out!
(This is my chance!)

The round becomes a one-on-one race between Claire
and Alexia. Then...
...the two grab the flag simultaneously.

*pant, pant* I finally reached the flag! It was a tie,
but great job, Alexia!

Speak for yourself, Claire! You made your best time
so far, didn't you? And I was the one in the lead
during practice...

It's all thanks to you for suggesting we focus at
the start... Oh, I just called you Alexia instead
of Princess Alexia…
Well, I'll let it slide this time. We're equals now.

Jeez, aren't you the pompous one... Fine, I'll
forgive you too.
The voices of the two resound joyfully. Meanwhile...

Seriously! What was that about?! It would've been
better if we'd gone easy on them from the start!

I-I couldn't help it! It was harder than our usual
work!

Making excuses won't change the fact that we lost.
Who knows what they'll say to us after we've been
acting so high and mighty?
*groan* Nooo!
Claire and Alexia approach Beta and Epsilon.
It looked like you lost your balance... Are you okay?
Th-Thank you for your concern. I'm fine...
Oh? Are you feeling down because you lost the round?
Ack! Go ahead and roast us! Beat us while we're down!
We never agreed to that...

Since you didn't go easy on us, we were able to run
passionately until the end. Thanks, you two.

Could you teach us some tips and tricks later?
I'm starting to enjoy this more and more!

I'm surprised they didn't say anything negative to us.
They may have been thinking it inside, but I'm grateful
for their positivity.
Ack... Yes... I'll admit defeat this time...

Thus, the intense race between the four of them comes
to an end as the sun goes down.

Beta and Epsilon return to their rooms first, while
Claire and Alexia stay behind, gazing at the ocean.
...We didn't end up finding your younger brother.
Yeah... But it's okay. I had lots of fun!

Well, it's not like we'll never see each other again!
We'll have a heart-to-heart next time we meet!

Yeah, I'm rooting for you. Well, we should head back
to our rooms—
Hey! Claire!
That voice...
Claire I finally found you!
Cid! Where have you?! Um...

Claire is about to shout as usual but recalls how Cid
pushed her away.
Cid...listen...I... I'm s-sorry—
Claire...I'm sorry...about what I said earlier.
...Huh?

Just as Claire is about to apologize, Cid interrupts
her with his own apology.

I realize I went too far with what I said. After
calming down, I've been waiting for the right
moment to apologize.

From now on, I'll do my best not to forget my
promises to you, and I'll be more careful with
how I express myself. So, please forgive me
for today.
Please...Claire..I'm sorry!
Cid...! You...!

I didn't know you had it in you to apologize like
that, Pooch!
(Heh... It's perfect!)

(I do feel a little bad about what happened, but I
can't miss this golden opportunity!)

(A sincere apology taking advantage of my sister's
weakened state... This should completely settle all
the promises I've broken until now.)

(And the perfect timing of this being on my way out.
It's an exquisite touch that allows me to go back
without any unnecessary aftercare.)

(The lines I'll deliver will be ordinary. A kind
younger brother who simply apologizes without
saying anything unnecessary...)

(This move is almost too perfect! It's the exact
image of side character "Brother A" I envisioned!)

(All that's left is for my sister to forgive me and
settle everything that's happened so far...)
You're not forgiven.
...Huh?

No, I'll forgive you! I'll forgive you, but...I still
haven't played at the beach with you, Cid!
(Something's not right here...)

There's no way I'm letting you just go home! Whether
I have to beg the hotel or camp out tonight, I'll do
whatever it takes to play with you at the beach!
(Why?)
I-In that case...can I...join...?

Of course! I'll let you borrow him after I'm
satisfied!
(Why?)

(Why can't I get the happy return home ending
scenario?!)

Heheh! Looks like tomorrow will be another fun day,
Princess Alexia!
Indeed! Claire!

Thus, the two manage to capture Cid. The next day,
Cid is forced to accompany Claire and Alexia on their
vacation.

Cid manages to make it through somehow and returns
home exhausted, only to discover that to his horror,
someone has ransacked his room. And so, Cid's perfect
vacation comes to a terrible end...
